command.name: archive
command.help:
The archive command creates an archive of the specified format
containing the files and directories of the Composer project or the specified
package in the specified version and writes it to the specified directory.

php composer.phar archive [--format=zip] [--dir=/foo] [package [version]]


Options:
--format(-f)Format of the resulting archive: tar or zip
--dirWrite the archive to this directory
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

option.name: --format
option.help: Format of the resulting archive: tar or zip

option.name: --dir
option.help: Write the archive to this directory

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.help: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir

command.name: browse
command.help:
The home command opens a package's repository URL or
homepage in your default browser.

To open the homepage by default, use -H or --homepage.

Options:
--homepage(-H)Open the homepage instead of the repository URL.
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.

--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: config
command.help:
This command allows you to edit some basic composer settings in either the
local composer.json file or the global config.json file.

To edit the global config.json file:

/www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar config --global

To add a repository:

/www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar config repositories.foo vcs http://bar.com

You can add a repository to the global config.json file by passing in the
--global option.

To edit the file in an external editor:

/www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar config --editor

To choose your editor you can set the "EDITOR" env variable.

To get a list of configuration values in the file:

/www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar config --list

You can always pass more than one option. As an example, if you want to edit the
global config.json file.

/www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar config --editor --global

Options:
--global(-g)Apply command to the global config file
--editor(-e)Open editor
--auth(-a)Affect auth config file (only used for --editor)
--unsetUnset the given setting-key
--list(-l)List configuration settings
--file(-f)If you want to choose a different composer.json or config.json
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

option.name: --global
option.help: Apply command to the global config file

option.name: --auth
option.help: Affect auth config file (only used for --editor)

option.help: If you want to choose a different composer.json or config.json

option.help: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.help: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: create-project
command.help:
The create-project command creates a new project from a given
package into a new directory. If executed without params and in a directory
with a composer.json file it installs the packages for the current project.

You can use this command to bootstrap new projects or setup a clean
version-controlled installation for developers of your project.

php composer.phar create-project vendor/project target-directory [version]

You can also specify the version with the package name using = or : as separator.

To install unstable packages, either specify the version you want, or use the
--stability=dev (where dev can be one of RC, beta, alpha or dev).

To setup a developer workable version you should create the project using the source
controlled code by appending the '--prefer-source' flag.

To install a package from another repository than the default one you
can pass the '--repository-url=http://myrepository.org' flag.


Options:
--stability(-s)Minimum-stability allowed (unless a version is specified).
--prefer-sourceForces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.
--prefer-distForces installation from package dist even for dev versions.
--repository-urlPick a different repository url to look for the package.
--devEnables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).
--no-devDisables installation of require-dev packages.
--no-pluginsWhether to disable plugins.
--no-custom-installersDEPRECATED: Use no-plugins instead.
--no-scriptsWhether to prevent execution of all defined scripts in the root package.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--keep-vcsWhether to prevent deletion vcs folder.
--no-installWhether to skip installation of the package dependencies.
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

option.help: Minimum-stability allowed (unless a version is specified).

option.name: --prefer-dist

option.name: --no-scripts

option.name: --keep-vcs

option.name: --no-install
option.help: Whether to skip installation of the package dependencies.

command.name: global
command.help:
Use this command as a wrapper to run other Composer commands
within the global context of COMPOSER_HOME.

You can use this to install CLI utilities globally, all you need
is to add the COMPOSER_HOME/vendor/bin dir to your PATH env var.

COMPOSER_HOME is c:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\Composer on Windows
and /home//.composer on unix systems.

Note: This path may vary depending on customizations to bin-dir in
composer.json or the environmental variable COMPOSER_BIN_DIR.


Options:
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: help
command.help:
The help command displays help for a given command:

php /www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar help list

You can also output the help in other formats by using the --format option:

php /www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar help --format=xml list

To display the list of available commands, please use the list command.

Options:
--xmlTo output help as XML
--formatTo output help in other formats
--rawTo output raw command help
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: init
command.help:
The init command creates a basic composer.json file
in the current directory.

php composer.phar init


Options:
--nameName of the package
--descriptionDescription of package
--authorAuthor name of package
--homepageHomepage of package
--requirePackage to require with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"
--require-devPackage to require for development with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"
--stability(-s)Minimum stability (empty or one of: stable, RC, beta, alpha, dev)
--license(-l)License of package
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

option.name: --require
option.help: Package to require with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"

option.name: --require-dev
option.help: Package to require for development with a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"

option.name: --stability
option.help: Minimum stability (empty or one of: stable, RC, beta, alpha, dev)

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.help: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.help: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: install
command.help:
The install command reads the composer.lock file from
the current directory, processes it, and downloads and installs all the
libraries and dependencies outlined in that file. If the file does not
exist it will look for composer.json and do the same.

php composer.phar install


Options:
--prefer-sourceForces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.
--prefer-distForces installation from package dist even for dev versions.
--dry-runOutputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
--devEnables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).
--no-devDisables installation of require-dev packages.
--no-pluginsDisables all plugins.
--no-custom-installersDEPRECATED: Use no-plugins instead.
--no-scriptsSkips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--optimize-autoloader(-o)Optimize autoloader during autoloader dump
--ignore-platform-reqsIgnore platform requirements (php & ext- packages).
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

option.name: --prefer-source
option.help: Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.

option.name: --prefer-dist
option.help: Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions.

option.name: --dry-run
option.help: Outputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).

option.name: --dev
option.help: Enables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).

option.name: --no-scripts
option.help: Skips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.help: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.help: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: list
command.help:
The list command lists all commands:

php /www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar list

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

php /www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar list test

You can also output the information in other formats by using the --format option:

php /www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar list --format=xml

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

php /www/fabfuel/prophiler/tools/composer/composer.phar list --raw

Options:
--xmlTo output list as XML
--rawTo output raw command list
--formatTo output list in other formats

option.name: --format
option.help: To output list in other formats

command.name: remove
command.help:
The remove command removes a package from the current
list of installed packages

php composer.phar remove


Options:
--devRemoves a package from the require-dev section.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--no-updateDisables the automatic update of the dependencies.
--update-no-devRun the dependency update with the --no-dev option.
--update-with-dependenciesAllows inherited dependencies to be updated with explicit dependencies.
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

option.name: --dev
option.help: Removes a package from the require-dev section.

option.name: --no-update
option.help: Disables the automatic update of the dependencies.

option.name: --update-no-dev
option.help: Run the dependency update with the --no-dev option.

option.name: --update-with-dependencies
option.help: Allows inherited dependencies to be updated with explicit dependencies.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction

option.name: --profile

option.help: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

command.name: require
command.help:
The require command adds required packages to your composer.json and installs them

If you do not want to install the new dependencies immediately you can call it with --no-update


Options:
--devAdd requirement to require-dev.
--prefer-sourceForces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.
--prefer-distForces installation from package dist even for dev versions.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--no-updateDisables the automatic update of the dependencies.
--update-no-devRun the dependency update with the --no-dev option.
--update-with-dependenciesAllows inherited dependencies to be updated with explicit dependencies.
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information

php composer.phar run-script post-update-cmd

command.name: self-update
command.help:
The self-update command checks getcomposer.org for newer
versions of composer and if found, installs the latest.

php composer.phar self-update


Options:
--rollback(-r)Revert to an older installation of composer
--clean-backupsDelete old backups during an update. This makes the current version of composer the only backup available after the update

command.name: update
command.help:
The update command reads the composer.json file from the
current directory, processes it, and updates, removes or installs all the
dependencies.

php composer.phar update

To limit the update operation to a few packages, you can list the package(s)
you want to update as such:

php composer.phar update vendor/package1 foo/mypackage [...]

You may also use an asterisk (*) pattern to limit the update operation to package(s)
from a specific vendor:

php composer.phar update vendor/package1 foo/* [...]

Options:
--prefer-sourceForces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.
--prefer-distForces installation from package dist even for dev versions.
--dry-runOutputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).
--devEnables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).
--no-devDisables installation of require-dev packages.
--lockOnly updates the lock file hash to suppress warning about the lock file being out of date.
--no-pluginsDisables all plugins.
--no-custom-installersDEPRECATED: Use no-plugins instead.
--no-scriptsSkips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.
--no-progressDo not output download progress.
--with-dependenciesAdd also all dependencies of whitelisted packages to the whitelist.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--optimize-autoloader(-o)Optimize autoloader during autoloader dump.
--ignore-platform-reqsIgnore platform requirements (php & ext- packages).
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

option.name: --prefer-source
option.help: Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.

option.name: --prefer-dist
option.help: Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions.

option.name: --dry-run
option.help: Outputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).

option.name: --dev
option.help: Enables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).

option.name: --lock
option.help: Only updates the lock file hash to suppress warning about the lock file being out of date.

option.name: --no-scripts
option.help: Skips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.

option.name: --with-dependencies
option.help: Add also all dependencies of whitelisted packages to the whitelist.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --profile
option.help: Display timing and memory usage information

option.name: --working-dir
option.help: If specified, use the given directory as working directory.

framework.help:
Usage:
[options] command [arguments]


Options:
--profileDisplay timing and memory usage information
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--working-dir(-d)If specified, use the given directory as working directory.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.

Available commands:
aboutShort information about Composer
archiveCreate an archive of this composer package
browseOpens the package's repository URL or homepage in your browser.
homeOpens the package's repository URL or homepage in your browser.
clear-cacheClears composer's internal package cache.
clearcacheClears composer's internal package cache.
configSet config options
create-projectCreate new project from a package into given directory.
dependsShows which packages depend on the given package
diagnoseDiagnoses the system to identify common errors.
dump-autoloadDumps the autoloader
dumpautoloadDumps the autoloader
globalAllows running commands in the global composer dir ($COMPOSER_HOME).
helpDisplays help for a command
initCreates a basic composer.json file in current directory.
installInstalls the project dependencies from the composer.lock file if present, or falls back on the composer.json.
licensesShow information about licenses of dependencies
listLists commands
removeRemoves a package from the require or require-dev
requireAdds required packages to your composer.json and installs them
run-scriptRun the scripts defined in composer.json.
searchSearch for packages
self-updateUpdates composer.phar to the latest version.
selfupdateUpdates composer.phar to the latest version.
showShow information about packages
statusShow a list of locally modified packages
updateUpdates your dependencies to the latest version according to composer.json, and updates the composer.lock file.
validateValidates a composer.json
